verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when all the kings of the Amorites, which were on the side of Jordan westward, and all the kings of the Canaanites, which were by the sea, heard that the LORD had dried up the waters of Jordan from before the children of Israel, until we were passed over, that their heart melted, neither was there spirit in them any more, because of the children of Israel.
verses.web: When all the kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan westward, and all the kings of the Canaanites, who were by the sea, heard how LORD had dried up the waters of the Jordan from before the children of Israel until we had crossed over, their heart melted, and there was no more spirit in them, because of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: When all the Amorite kings west of the Jordan and all the Canaanite kings along the coast heard that the LORD had dried up the Jordan River so the Israelites could cross, their courage melted away. They were completely paralyzed with fear because of the Israelites.

verses.kjv: At that time the LORD said unto Joshua, Make thee sharp knives, and circumcise again the children of Israel the second time.
verses.web: At that time, LORD said to Joshua, “Make flint knives, and circumcise again the sons of Israel the second time.”
verses.ct: At that time the LORD told Joshua, "Make flint knives and circumcise the men of Israel again."

verses.kjv: And Joshua made him sharp knives, and circumcised the children of Israel at the hill of the foreskins.
verses.web: Joshua made himself flint knives, and circumcised the sons of Israel at the hill of the foreskins.
verses.ct: So Joshua made flint knives and circumcised the Israelite men at a place that became known as the Hill of Foreskins.

verses.kjv: And this is the cause why Joshua did circumcise: All the people that came out of Egypt, that were males, even all the men of war, died in the wilderness by the way, after they came out of Egypt.
verses.web: This is the reason Joshua circumcised them: all the people who came out of Egypt, who were males, even all the men of war, died in the wilderness along the way, after they came out of Egypt.
verses.ct: Here's why the circumcision was necessary: every male who had left Egypt as a fighting man had died in the wilderness during the journey from Egypt.

verses.kjv: Now all the people that came out were circumcised: but all the people that were born in the wilderness by the way as they came forth out of Egypt, them they had not circumcised.
verses.web: For all the people who came out were circumcised; but all the people who were born in the wilderness along the way as they came out of Egypt had not been circumcised.
verses.ct: All the men who left Egypt had been circumcised, but none of the boys born during the wilderness journey had been circumcised.

verses.kjv: For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness, till all the people that were men of war, which came out of Egypt, were consumed, because they obeyed not the voice of the LORD: unto whom the LORD sware that he would not shew them the land, which the LORD sware unto their fathers that he would give us, a land that floweth with milk and honey.
verses.web: For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness until all the nation, even the men of war who came out of Egypt, were consumed, because they didn’t listen to LORD’s voice. LORD swore to them that he wouldn’t let them see the land which LORD swore to their fathers that he would give us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.ct: The Israelites had wandered in the wilderness for 40 years until every fighting man who had left Egypt was dead — because they had refused to obey the LORD. The LORD had sworn they would never see the land he had promised their ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey.

verses.kjv: And their children, whom he raised up in their stead, them Joshua circumcised: for they were uncircumcised, because they had not circumcised them by the way.
verses.web: Their children, whom he raised up in their place, were circumcised by Joshua, for they were uncircumcised, because they had not circumcised them on the way.
verses.ct: So Joshua circumcised their sons, the generation God raised up to replace them. These men had never been circumcised because it hadn't been done during the journey.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when they had done circumcising all the people, that they abode in their places in the camp, till they were whole.
verses.web: When they were done circumcising the whole nation, they stayed in their places in the camp until they were healed.
verses.ct: After every man had been circumcised, they stayed in camp and rested until they had fully healed.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, This day have I rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you. Wherefore the name of the place is called Gilgal unto this day.
verses.web: LORD said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt from you.” Therefore the name of that place was called Gilgal to this day.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to Joshua, "Today I have rolled away the shame of Egypt from you." That's why the place is called Gilgal to this day — because "Gilgal" sounds like the Hebrew word for "rolling away."

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel encamped in Gilgal, and kept the passover on the fourteenth day of the month at even in the plains of Jericho.
verses.web: The children of Israel encamped in Gilgal. They kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month at evening in the plains of Jericho.
verses.ct: While camped at Gilgal on the plains of Jericho, the Israelites celebrated the Passover on the evening of the 14th day of the month.

verses.kjv: And they did eat of the old corn of the land on the morrow after the passover, unleavened cakes, and parched corn in the selfsame day.
verses.web: They ate unleavened cakes and parched grain of the produce of the land on the next day after the Passover, in the same day.
verses.ct: The very next day after the Passover, they ate food grown in the land — unleavened bread and roasted grain.

verses.kjv: And the manna ceased on the morrow after they had eaten of the old corn of the land; neither had the children of Israel manna any more; but they did eat of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year.
verses.web: The manna ceased on the next day, after they had eaten of the produce of the land. The children of Israel didn’t have manna any more, but they ate of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year.
verses.ct: The manna stopped the day after they ate the produce of the land. The Israelites never had manna again. From that point on, they ate the food that grew in Canaan.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted up his eyes and looked, and, behold, there stood a man over against him with his sword drawn in his hand: and Joshua went unto him, and said unto him, Art thou for us, or for our adversaries?
verses.web: When Joshua was by Jericho, he lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, a man stood in front of him with his sword drawn in his hand. Joshua went to him and said to him, “Are you for us, or for our enemies?”
verses.ct: One day when Joshua was near Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing in front of him with a drawn sword in his hand. Joshua walked up to him and asked, "Are you on our side, or on our enemies' side?"

verses.kjv: And he said, Nay; but as captain of the host of the LORD am I now come. And Joshua fell on his face to the earth, and did worship, and said unto him, What saith my lord unto his servant?
verses.web: He said, “No; but I have come now as commander of LORD’s army.” Joshua fell on his face to the earth, and worshiped, and asked him, “What does my lord say to his servant?”
verses.ct: "Neither," the man replied. "I have come as the commander of the LORD's army." Joshua immediately fell facedown to the ground in worship and said, "What does my lord want to say to his servant?"

verses.kjv: And the captain of the LORD’s host said unto Joshua, Loose thy shoe from off thy foot; for the place whereon thou standest is holy. And Joshua did so.
verses.web: The prince of LORD’s army said to Joshua, “Take off your sandals, for the place on which you stand is holy.” Joshua did so.
verses.ct: The commander of the LORD's army said to Joshua, "Take off your sandals, because the place where you're standing is holy ground." And Joshua did.
